# Frontend-Only Prototype: AI-First CMS

Build a frontend prototype (no backend) demonstrating the visionary AI-First CMS interface.

## Core UI Components to Prototype

### 1. Conversational Content Assistant
- Chat interface overlaying the workspace
- Simulated AI responses for content creation requests
- Natural language input for commands like "Draft a blog post about Q3 results"

### 2. In-Context AI Editor
- Live website preview with "AI Edit Mode" toggle
- Click any text/image/section to get AI suggestions tooltip
- Side panel logging changes with undo capability
- Contextual overlays for suggestions

### 3. Trust & Compliance Dashboard
- Visible "Trust Score" shield in top nav (green/yellow/red states)
- Gamified compliance checklist (e.g., "95/100 points")
- Drill-down view showing specific issues (missing alt text, meta descriptions)
- Celebratory animations when hitting milestones

### 4. Spatial Content Canvas (stretch goal)
- Infinite canvas showing site structure as cards/nodes
- Pan and zoom navigation
- Visual clustering of related pages

## Tech Stack
- Pure frontend (React/Vue/vanilla JS - your choice)
- Mock data for all AI responses
- Focus on UX polish and interactions

## Key Interactions to Demo
- Chat with AI assistant → see simulated response
- Toggle AI Edit Mode → click elements → see suggestion popups
- View Trust Score → drill into compliance items
- Mark compliance items complete → score updates

## Not In Scope
- Actual AI/LLM integration
- Backend/database
- Authentication
- Real content management

## Success Criteria
- Demonstrates the "wow factor" of AI-first CMS UX
- Feels like chatting with a colleague, not using software
- Compliance feels empowering, not burdensome

# UX Flow Overhaul: Map-First, Action-Driven Chat

## New User Flow

### Step 1: Website Map (Landing View)
- Show spatial map/tree of the website structure
- Visual representation of all pages, sections, hierarchy
- This is the FIRST thing users see

### Step 2: Action Selection
User clicks on the map or selects from options:
1. **Change something** - Edit existing page/section
2. **Add a new page** - Create new page in the site structure  
3. **Add a blog post** - Create new blog content

### Step 3: Contextual Chat Opens
Based on the action, a chat interface opens with context:
- Chat knows WHAT action was selected
- Chat knows WHERE in the site map (if applicable)

### Step 4: In-Chat Capabilities
- **Discussion** - Natural language about what user wants
- **Layout selection** - Show layout templates/options
- **Document drop zone** - Accept:
  - Decks (PDF, PPTX)
  - Text documents (DOCX, TXT, MD)
  - Images (PNG, JPG, SVG)
- AI extracts content from dropped documents

### Step 5: AI Page Generation
AI suggests a complete page with:
- **SEO optimization** - Meta tags, titles, descriptions
- **Keyword suggestions** - Based on content + trends
- **Brand guideline validation** - Check tone, colors, terminology
- **Compliance checks** - GDPR notices, accessibility

## UI Components Needed

1. SiteMap.jsx - Visual website structure (tree or canvas)
2. ActionSelector.jsx - Modal/overlay for action choice
3. DocumentDropZone.jsx - Drag-drop area for files
4. LayoutPicker.jsx - Visual layout template selector
5. SEOPanel.jsx - Shows keyword suggestions, meta preview
6. BrandValidator.jsx - Shows brand compliance status

## Mock Data Needed
- Sample website structure (5-10 pages)
- 3-4 layout templates
- Mock SEO suggestions
- Mock brand guidelines checklist

## Flow Diagram
```
[Site Map] → [Action: Change/Add Page/Add Blog] → [Chat + Drops + Layouts] → [AI Generated Page Preview]
```

title: Intent-first content creation flow
description:
Redesign UX flow: user first selects intent (new page / edit existing / blog post), then enters chat where they can describe content, drop files (docs, images, presentations), select from 3-4 layout options, view SEO details, verify against brand book, then confirm.

Current state: chat overlays workspace
Target state: intent → chat → enrich → confirm

Sub-tasks:
1. Intent selection screen (new page / edit existing / blog post)
2. File drop zone in chat (documents, images, presentations)
3. Layout picker (3-4 layout options to choose from)
4. SEO preview panel
5. Brand book validation
6. Confirmation step

title: Confirmation step
description:
Final confirmation before publishing:
- Show full preview of generated content
- Display all settings (layout, SEO, etc)
- Brand compliance status
- Publish / Save Draft / Edit More options
- Success state with link to published content
